alert.note: Alert for Durham; Granville; Halifax; Orange; Vance; Warren (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Durham, Granville, Halifax, Orange, Person, Vance and Warren. * WHEN...Until 600 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 359 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated lingering showers across the Advisory area. While the heaviest rainfall has ended, additional storms are moving into the region. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Roanoke Rapids, Henderson, Oxford, Roxboro, Warrenton, Halifax, Norlina, Littleton, Rougemont, Concord, Weldon, Stem, Stovall, Middleburg, Macon, Dabney, South Henderson, Satterwhite Point Marina, Steele Creek Marina & Campground and Gillburg. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Durham; Granville; Halifax; Orange; Vance; Warren
